channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why investors are making a big mistake by not worrying more about tariffs
item.description: President Trump’s tariff fight no longer looks to be the biggest worry keeping investors up at night, according to a new BofA Global survey.

item.title: Sweetgreen’s customers are cutting back on pricey salads. Will extra chicken help?
item.description: Sweetgreen’s stock is sliding toward its worst day on record, and the company says it’s boosting some portion sizes to enhance the value proposition.

item.title: ‘This scam stuff is going to get worse’: A man approached me in my car — he had a crazy story
item.description: “I got rid of him by asking for a business card and a company name, and he bugged out.”

item.title: Gold and bitcoin are both vying to be safe havens for investors. Why gold is winning so far this year.
item.description: There has been no shortage of investor jitters in 2025, and gold is showing no sign of ceding its crown as the go-to safe haven.

item.title: Trade Desk’s stock sees its worst drop ever, and analysts wonder if Amazon is to blame
item.description: Some say newfound competition is pressuring Trade Desk’s growth, but the ad-tech company’s CEO brushed off the Amazon threat.

item.title: Why Tesla's latest move could be a boon for Nvidia, AMD
item.description: Tesla's move to shut down its Dojo supercomputer team likely increases its usage of general purpose GPUs for artificial intelligence, Wells Fargo said...

item.title: Alternative assets are headed for your 401(k) — here's what investors need to know
item.description: President Donald Trump's executive order paves the way to bring alternatives into 401(k)s, but what that will eventually look like remains to be seen.

item.title: Monster Beverage’s Q2 2025 Earnings Pop: Why MNST Stock Is Buzzing Today

item.title: August will be a down month for the stock market as growth slows, warns UBS' Garthwaite
item.description: The Wall Street firm believes the U.S. economic data is poised to continue to deteriorate, threatening the market's bull run.

item.title: Cement stocks poised for a breakout to new highs, says Carter Worth

item.title: Value investor Bill Nygren breaks down how he's finding hidden gems in an expensive stock market
item.description: While his picks don't offer exceptional organic growth, Nygren looks for the companies that have solid repurchase or dividend programs in place.
